subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_01A7_01C9D936.BE2B9B40
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

2 different things happening-that's why. When you get EVP that everyone und=
erstands, it is outward, in the environment. Not a communication through su=
bconscious means.

EVP that people swear they hear, but noone else can make=
 sense, may be a message to them via subconscious means. That isn't to say =
that ALL EVP's like this are true messages, I am sure alot are just matrixi=
ng.

But then that is how the art of scrying starts-matrixing. Like the Ror=
schach tests. The images you matrix with those gives the psychologist an in=
sight into your mind.

By gazing into a dark, reflective surface, you start=
 to see cloudy images. At first, you will just be matrixing faces in the cl=
ouds and not getting much substance. Try it, you will see what I am saying.=
 With practice, you start to see clear, concise images.

I think that is wh=
at happening with audio as well.

We already know for a fact pareidolia can=
 occur in audio as well as visual stimulus.

  ----- Original Message -----=
 
  From: Eric VanDuzer 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, =
May 20, 2009 10:19 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.





=
  yes I understand its personal to that particular individual but why can't=
 I hear it.  I have gotten some very personal EVPs through the traditional =
investigation way (not through a box or anything of that matter) that all o=
thers have heard.



  On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 12:15 PM, April Abercrombie =
<april@...> wrote:





    "If one person is not =
meant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am not quite ready to believ=
e that one right yet)." 

    I don't know for sure about that one either, =
but I am not ready to discount it either, especially since I stumbled acros=
s the possibility of audible scrying. But I am sure alot of people don't be=
lieve in scrying at all either.

    What makes it a possibility to me is t=
hat so many people are hearing things that are very personal, but stuff the=
y would not have come up with on their own.


      ----- Original Message =
----- 
      From: Eric VanDuzer 
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      =
Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 10:09 AM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I h=
ave a question.


      I think that is the problem I am having though Jim.=
  When you say "work them over till you hear them"  to me I should not have=
 to work them over till I hear them.  Yes taking out the ambient and backgr=
ound noise is one thing.  But if you just keep on listening to them with di=
fferent enhancements you are bound to hear something (matrixing).  If one p=
erson is not meant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am not quite re=
ady to believe that one right yet).  I think you all know what I am getting=
 at.  



      On Tue, May 19, 2009 at 9:11 PM, James W. Hyslope <clockdry=
ve@...> wrote:




        Well, for myself...I don't "clean" them up=
 to much because I really don't know HOW :) (well a little bit)Since I've o=
nly been at it for a couple weeks. BUT if you can clean up something to whe=
re you can FIND what was there to begin with "you have done no harm" I hear=
 alot more than others I guess, and I haven't enhanced many of my evp's.*If=
 anyone is able to clean them up...I DO promise you will hear what I say is=
 correct)Pretty BOLD statement, but if you are able to clean it up with bet=
ter software (please do for others too) I will be more than happy to "liste=
n" where I made a mistake...I can only LEARN from it :) I have done some DE=
EP enhancements to a few of my evp's...from the begining I could only hear =
clicks and thumps.....but after messing with that area, eventually I would =
hear the true voices (and can tell if male or female...approximate age) and=
 understand the mood also....these where extreamly modified, and I feel tha=
t I could NOT have added enough "simple" enhancements that would ADD a voic=
e....full of emotion and distinct syllables :) And some just can't hear the=
m for what ever reason be it equipment that is used to hear (pc-headphones-=
speakers-ears) know one has the perfect match of all these things. Check ou=
t "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" in the files section....work them over till you hea=
r them. I really can't do much more :)--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Eric =
VanDuzer <evanduzer@...> wrote:
        >
        > Now I may be biased to =
the "investigation" way of doing things. I do clean
        > up evps if I =
hear something and can't make it out do to ambient noise. So
        > hear=
 is my question. When do you stop cleaning up? Wouldn't to much
        > e=
nhancing "taint" the results? To me the more enhancing you do the less
    =
    > convincing it becomes. I hope noone finds this offensive, it is not m=
eant
        > to be I am just really curious. The way I look at it is that=
 if you have to
        > do so much enhancing to find anything, was there =
really something there to
        > begin with. Are we just making ourselve=
s believe there is something there??
        > 
        > Eric
        >


=
